summary: Biology encompasses the study of life and organisms in various ecosystems defined by unique biotic and abiotic factors. The concept of an ecosystem has evolved to include non-natural organizations, reflecting a trend towards decentralized and resilient structures. This holistic approach integrates principles from multiple disciplines to foster organic networks that thrive across different spatial and temporal scales.
excerpt: Biological ecosystems are specific to space and time, but the term ecosystem has been broadened to describe non-natural organizations, underscoring a shift towards organic, decentralized structures.
